bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia was founded in 1812 "for the encouragement and cultivation of the sciences, and the advancement of useful learning." The Communications Department is responsible for external affairs of the Academy, including public and media relations.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Communications Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences. The collection includes correspondence, marketing and event planning documents; minutes; press releases (1967-1997); press kits; brochures, programs, schedules, and advertisements; financial documents; educational and promotional videos; teacher guides; photos and slides of events and programs; and subject files related to Academy exhibits, publications, and projects. There is a set of 16 scrapbooks, kept between 1967 and 1987, that contain newspaper and magazine clippings about Academy events and staff, plus one earlier scrapbook covering the years 1928 to 1955. In addition, there are loose press clippings dating from 1966 to 1999. There are a number of photographs of staff and exhibits, as well as "stock" photos of animals, plants, and geological features. Notable programs and events covered by the collection include Dinofest, the Schuykill River Symposium (1980), the Schuykill River Watershed Initiative (1995), Spotlight on the Schuykill (1995); and the construction of Dinosaur Hall and the Discovering Dinosaurs exhibit. Other items in the collection include a hardcopy printout of the Academy's web pages on Joseph Leidy; audio tapes of radio spots (mostly by Howard Coffin), annual meetings, and interviews 1983-1994; an oversize invitation to the Academy's "Night with the Birds and Beasts" gala in 1968; correspondence and documents relating to "Explorer Series" lecture and presentations, 1980-1982; and a press kit and photos relating to the "Deinonyclus" sculpture.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
